results.definition: used of homologous chromosomes associated in pairs in synapsis
a stand-in for movie stars to perform dangerous stunts
examples: his first job in Hollywood was as a double for Clark Gable

results.definition: a base hit on which the batter stops safely at second base
examples: he hit a double to deep centerfield

results.definition: make or do or perform again
consisting of or involving two parts or components usually in pairs
examples: an egg with a double yolk
duple (or double) time consists of two (or a multiple of two) beats to a measure

results.definition: having more than one decidedly dissimilar aspects or qualities
examples: a double (or dual) role for an actor
every episode has its double and treble meaning

results.definition: raising the stakes in a card game by a factor of 2
examples: I decided his double was a bluff

results.definition: bend over or curl up, usually with laughter or pain
having two meanings with intent to deceive
someone who closely resembles a famous person (especially an actor)
a quantity that is twice as great as another
bridge: make a demand for (a card or suit)
do double duty; serve two purposes or have two functions
examples: She doubles as his wife and secretary

results.definition: used of flowers having more than the usual number of petals in crowded or overlapping arrangements
examples: double chrysanthemums have many rows of petals and are usually spherical or hemispherical
